data.text: Every suicide is a tragedy. It's also a global phenomenon. Break the stigma & taboo. #LetsTalk this Monday on World #SuicidePrevention Day via @WHO: https://t.co/LjJTFsKRJG https://t.co/cwi8JTgnK4

Climate change is real and it is happening now.

Watch live as @antonioguterres outlines his vision for urgent #ClimateAction on Monday at 3pm NY time: https://t.co/WhwXXmUzNN https://t.co/YC4nE1ACxI

Get on board for a better future! @ThomasFriends and the UN are working together to teach kids what they can do for the #GlobalGoals. Learn more: https://t.co/LZagf72Qwp #AllAboardForGlobalGoals https://t.co/Nrze6YEd9y
See how @UN_Women is building bridges through sport for young refugee girls in their host communities. ⬇️ https://t.co/Tu2696uWXB https://t.co/4twmwviQZM

1 building. 193 countries. Countless opportunities for change. Watch as history unfolds when the 73rd session of #UNGA kicks off in two weeks' time. 
Follow the action here: https://t.co/SoR2GrJ026 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/nlXcDAZkT8

"The catastrophic impact of nuclear testing has had profound effects on the environment, human health, food security and economic development." -- @antonioguterres marking Int'l Day Against Nuclear Tests https://t.co/0x6ByycasP https://t.co/AKmKpmhZTj

"We delivered concrete results for people – and were able to overcome our narrow national views & positions in the interest of compromise."
-- Outgoing @UN_PGA Miroslav Lajčák speaks to @UN_News_Centre ⬇️ https://t.co/nM4xGhVdnc
The UN Convention on waste makes breakthrough recommendations to #beatpollution & rid the world of marine debris. Details from @brsmeas: https://t.co/uSzmPEy2eA https://t.co/YB7vAW1VP5

#AllAboardForGlobalGoals and gender equality! We've teamed up with @ThomasFriends to teach kids that we all go farther when men & women are on the same track. https://t.co/LZagf72Qwp #GlobalGoals https://t.co/jyvrn4UXBo

UN Victims’ Rights Advocate Jane Connors visited a @UNFPA Community Centre in Zaatari Refugee Camp, Jordan, where she is seeing 1st-hand the UN’s response to sexual exploitation & abuse, and support for victims. https://t.co/kGA8vr8S0o https://t.co/i2oQKGNXSP

Globalisation & digital technology are transforming the way people work, live & learn and generating new skill demands. More from @UNESCO on Saturday's International #LiteracyDay: https://t.co/8dWilFJNJ6 https://t.co/yT8NUucwBk

Climate change is a race we can win. We already have the solutions, but we need governments, businesses & individuals to implement them. 
#RiseForClimate & demand #ClimateAction. ➡️ https://t.co/roJjv7ZtSS https://t.co/wpNa1M0akV

No one should be afraid to go to school. Yet for many students around the world, it's a dangerous place. Make your voice heard. Help @UNICEF #EndViolence in schools: https://t.co/nwg9ayWbJP https://t.co/hcAjSl5tXy
We need to rethink how we grow, share & consume our food in order to achieve #ZeroHunger. Here's how you can  help: https://t.co/ix7Sb0jcf8 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/xu7JJfswcK

Afghanistan, now more than ever, needs the support of the international community. Without a solution to displacement, there will be no lasting peace.
- UN @RefugeesChief Filippo Grandi, in Kabul https://t.co/DCArgARbcS

Saturday is International #LiteracyDay!

Literacy opens doors to knowledge and is necessary for improving lives & livelihoods: https://t.co/8dWilFJNJ6 https://t.co/fR90F7YHXX

#FBF to 1946 and the first UN General Assembly in London. On 24 Sept leaders and changemakers will gather in NYC for the 73rd #UNGA. Follow the action: https://t.co/SoR2GrJ026 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/X99VsNeo6z

The #UNMediaSeminar on Peace in the Middle East wrapped up on Thursday. See what diplomats, journalists, experts & young people who attended the event in Moscow said here: https://t.co/CwloDsLbbD./ https://t.co/TY4dnbFzxz

South Sudan: With guilty verdicts handed down, perpetrators of violence against civilians at Terrain Hotel in Juba in 2016 are held accountable for their crimes. Details from @unmissmedia: https://t.co/ZWWARseZDY

On Wednesday's International #CharityDay, thanks to all who do their part to make the world a better place!

Globally, more than 1.4 billion adults are not doing enough physical activity - and the problem is especially worrisome for women. 

@WHO has info on how to #BeActive here: https://t.co/aq0atqXoTP #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Rg6Q15VJmH

The world's ocean resources need better protection on the high seas. Countries are working to form a new int'l agreement to conserve marine biodiversity and help #SaveOurOcean. https://t.co/LpSpS4OcFG #BBNJ https://t.co/S9FwCzGpF9

"In a world where billions of people can communicate as they wish, many more groups & individuals demand, & have, a say in creating the future" -- @alison_smale in @_UNChronicle on the need for all voices to be heard to reach the #GlobalGoals https://t.co/K9I04xyNzm https://t.co/3iUJPJ0nCZ

https://t.co/ix7Sb01BnA https://t.co/sqfF89AJer

Starts on Monday: #LakeChadBerlin conference on how to best address the crisis in the region & meet the needs of those affected. Details: https://t.co/3LlyTVeDdz https://t.co/FVU9zUGjHt

Watch as history is made: Every year, world leaders meet at UNHQ in NYC to tackle major challenges facing humanity. The 73rd session of #UNGA opens on 18 Sept. Get ready for the greatest geopolitical debate of the year. https://t.co/xku27DezG8

Join upcoming #Gaza5K runs hosted by @UNRWAUSA in DC & Houston to show solidarity w/ Palestine refugees in Gaza & raise funds for @UNRWA Community Mental Health programmes. Info is here: https://t.co/BOn0dxyN92 https://t.co/DkLxyrTffj

An initiative to restore 100 million hectares of deforested & degraded land across Africa by 2030 was discussed at the #glfnairobi2018 this week. 

#ThinkLandscape restoration to meet the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/YBWEAJc8kh https://t.co/1Z1G2a0k1O

800+ women around the 🌍 still die every day from causes related to pregnancy or childbirth. Here's one update from Kenya on how @UNOPS @UNICEF & @DFID_UK are working together to make motherhood safer:
https://t.co/9s9frlGpVa https://t.co/rfdkQOE78U
History was made in Tunisia. Achieving gender parity is central to achieving the UN #GlobalGoals. Update from @UN_Women https://t.co/jpR3oczFst

Now is a pivotal period to turn the tide on the DRC Ebola outbreak to ensure it does not spread further. Health teams are working 24/7. This week top @WHO officials gave a 1st-hand update on their work. https://t.co/bkYB2s2Tfp

"I have heard gut-wrenching accounts…of grave torture, of women brutally violated, people whose loved ones have been killed before their eyes." -- Cate Blanchett, @refugees Goodwill Ambassador briefed Security Council on  situation of Rohingya refugees. https://t.co/1eSI8Y6vXG https://t.co/bxeq4TVjUr

As students head back to school in many parts of the world, here's the story of immigrant & refugee children in upstate New York. Many have survived difficult journeys, but remain remarkably resilient. Watch 🎥 👇 https://t.co/DxygnxNjao
History will be made this week as a @UPU_UN "Extraordinary Congress" is held for the 1st time since 1900. #postaldialogue https://t.co/EXEv1q5wpS

Welcome to Twitter, @JoyceMsuya. Great to see a @UNEnvironment official tweeting in English & Kiswhaili. Follow @UmojaWaMataifa for related updates, too. https://t.co/C5vilOkNtf

#TBT to 1957 when V.K. Krishna Menon of India gave what is said to be longest speech to the Security Council. He was reportedly hospitalized after 5 hours, but continued for 3 hours more the next day. https://t.co/svznemQth6 via @UN_DPA https://t.co/9zYuJ3cIpY
